item.title: AwesomeWM: about title bars and toggling them
item.description: The default rc.lua from Awesome 4.0 turns title bars on. Here I show how you can turn them off, and also how I enable them only for floating clients.

item.title: AwesomeWM: Alternative bindings setup
item.description:
The default rc.lua from the Awesome window manager uses a lot of globalkeys = awful.util.table.join(...) code.

I disliked this because …

  • in Lua, the last field of a table cannot have a comma. So often when I moved an entry around, I ended up with a pointless syntax error because of a missing or trailing comma
  • adding elements by joining seems somewhat complex
  • adding logic, e.g. only adding a keybinding under specific circumstances is suddenly more difficult

So let’s change this …

item.title: AwesomeWM: Tags and Layout setup
item.description: In this post I show a nice method to define tags and associated layouts, where the tag names change dynamically when the layout changes.

item.title: AwesomeWM: using a global title bar
item.description: This post shows how you can create a global titlebar. I personally removed the tasklist and replaced this with the titlebar. The tasklist wasn’t good looking anyway and so far I don’t miss the tasklist.
